critique: This document is an executive order regarding the administration of the Employees' Compensation Act for employees of the Alaska Railroad. It shifts the administrative responsibility from the General Manager of the Railroad to the Federal Security Agency. This appears to be a matter of internal government management and reorganization. It doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power in a broad sense, or civil liberties. It has a slight impact on federalism by centralizing administration at the federal level. It also has a slight impact on economic regulation by centralizing employee compensation.
